kubejs.ponder.tag.nature_aura.descriptio: Building guide for natures aura multiblocks
kubejs.ponder.tag.in_world.description: Explanation of in world crafting with multiple placed blocks
kubejs.ponder.furnace_crafting.text_1: Right click the middle block with Coal Coke in hand
kubejs.ponder.magical_generator_crafting: Drop Lemon Quartz in the middle
kubejs.ponder.nature_altar.header: Building nature altar in the overworld
kubejs.ponder.sacrificial_altar.text_1: For the altar to work we need a specific sacrifice
kubejs.ponder.sacrificial_altar.text_2: Right click with the sacrificial dagger on the altar with the other item in your offhand
kubejs.ponder.sacrificial_altar.text_3: It will result in new item created and the death of our sacrifice
kubejs.ponder.tree_ritual.text_1: It doesnt matter which block you use for the floor, except for the middle which need to be able to plant sapling on
kubejs.ponder.tree_ritual.text_2: Place items on the wooden stand
kubejs.ponder.tree_ritual.text_3: Make the sapling grow to finish the craft!
kubejs.ponder.tree_ritual.text_4: Gold powder is consumed in the process
kubejs.ponder.wissen_basics.text_1: Wissen altar creates Wissen from Arcanum and Arcanum Dust
kubejs.ponder.wissen_basics.text_2: First use your wand in Recieve Connect Mode on the altar
kubejs.ponder.wissen_basics.text_3: Then use your wand on Wissen Translator in the same mode
kubejs.ponder.wissen_basics.text_4: Now lets do the same but with Arcane Workbench and Send Connect Mode
kubejs.ponder.wissen_basics.text_5: Arcane Workbench should be getting wissen now
kubejs.ponder.wissen_basics.text_6: Now place your items like in normal workbench and right click it with a wand in a Functional Mode
